ARABIC: قَالَ بَلْ فَعَلَهُۥ كَبِيرُهُمْ هَٰذَا فَسْـَٔلُوهُمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ يَنطِقُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'No, this one, the biggest of them, did it. Ask them if they are able to speak!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: No," he said. "It was done by that chief of theirs. Ask him in case they can speak."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He answered: "Rather it was this supreme one who has done it. So ask them, if they can speak."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He replied, "I think the biggest among them has broken the smaller ones. Ask them if they are able to speak".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Said he, “Rather, their chief may have done it; so question them, if they can speak.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: Surely (some doer) has done it; the chief of them is this, therefore ask them, if they can speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'No; it was this great one of them that did it. Question them; if they are able to speak!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: But this, their chief hath done it. So question them, if they can speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He answered, "Rather this biggest one of them did it. Ask them, if they can speak."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: rather he hath wrought it: this big one of them: so question them, if they ever speak.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘No, it was this biggest one of them who did it! Ask them, if they can speak.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Nay, this one, the biggest of them (idols) did it. Ask them, if they can speak!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No' he replied. 'It was their great one amongst them that did it. Ask them, if they are able to speak'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “But it was this biggest of them that did it. Ask them, if they can speak.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:63] He said, concealing his deed: ‘Rather it was this principal one among them did it. So question them, about the perpetrator of this, if they can speak!’ (here the response to the conditional statement precedes [the conditional clause]; in the preceding clause there is an intimation for them that an idol, acknowledged as being incapable of action, cannot be a god).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: He said) Abraham said: (But this, their chief) who has the axe on its shoulder (hath done it. So question them, if they can speak) so that they can inform you who broke them.
